sub_title: Senior Specialist in LiDAR and Photogrammetry
summary:
Develop algorithms automatically for 3D building reconstruction from LiDAR (aerial, mobile and terrestrial laser scanning) data
Exploit LiDAR-based technologies for infrastructure inspection and monitoring, as-built 3D models for building and bridge modeling information, and road detection
Experience on using FEM to analyze various structures (e.g. bridges and buildings)
Assess building damages caused by tunnel/excavation-induced ground movements

Specialties: 

 - LiDAR and photogrammetry: 3D Object Reconstruction from LiDAR data and photogrammetry, scan to BIM, deformation measurement and damage detection, integration of TLS data for real-time construction quality control, reconstruction of road profiles, and solar energy planning and forest
- Infrastructure inspection and monitoring, structural health monitoring, structural modeling, soil-structure interaction modeling, and building damage assessment
- High-performance computing

awards.title: First place 2015 IEEE GRSS Data Fusion Contest
awards.description: This paper presents a workflow including a novel algorithm for road detection from dense LiDAR fused with high-resolution aerial imagery data. Using a supervised machine learning approach point clouds are firstly classified into one of three groups: building, ground, or unassigned. Ground points are further processed by a novel algorithm to extract a road network. The algorithm exploits the high variance of slope and height of the point data in the direction orthogonal to the road boundaries. Applying the proposed approach on a 40 million point dataset successfully extracted a complex road network with an F-measure of 76.9%.

projects.title: Laser Scanning for Automatic Bridge Assessment

contributors.headline: Senior Specialist in LiDAR and Photogrammetry

projects.title: Laser Scanning for Automatic Bridge Rating
projects.description: Bridges are playing important roles on road networks to connect different daily services for Europe inhabitants. Yet, bridges are subjected to deterioration due to excessive usage, overloading, aging, and environmental impact, which cause reserve capacity, resilience, and the remaining service life. Thus, regular, rapid, and cost-effective assessment of bridges is critical during regular operation and after extreme events. Such assessment is also needed for planning critical maintenance and repair. In practice, general inspections are required for bridges bi-annually. With such interval times, damage may not be documented in a sufficiently timely manner to prevent catastrophic collapse. Moreover, the inspection method has many downsides: subjective results, expensive procedures, high safety risks for inspectors, requirements of experienced and trained inspectors, and traffic closures. To address these issues, by taking advantage of unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) and Light Detection And Ranging (LiDAR), the project will develop automatic, robust, efficient methods to process LiDAR data for condition rating.

profile_positions.description:
Develop solutions to automatically process LiDAR and Photogrammetry for 3D modeling, inspection, and monitoring of infrastructures (railways, roads, and bridges).
Investigate workflows to maximize usage of LiDAR and Photogrammetry for Digital Twins
profile_positions.title: Senior Specialist

profile_positions.description: I got a Marie Curie Individual Fellowship to work on the project titled "BRIDGESCAN - Laser Scanning for Automatic Bridge Assessment". The project will use a terrestrial laser scanner and unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) or drones with either camera or laser sensors to capture 3D topographic information of the bridge structures. The project will develop methods for automatically processing data to: (1) recognise individual structural components, (2) extract quality and quantity of structural deficiencies and (3) reconstruct 3D geometric models of the bridge components.
profile_positions.title: Marie Curie Fellowship

profile_positions.description: Develop algorithms for automatically generate telecom and electricity towers from 3D point clouds.
profile_positions.title: Point Cloud Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Project 1: Laser Scanning for Automatic Bridge Rating funded by University College Dublin
Role: PI
Main duty:
- Develop a procedure to acquire 3D topographic data of bridge structures for bridge assessment
- Use UAV to collect data of the bridge
- Develop methods for processing a point cloud to detect damage of bridge structures
- Develop a machine learning technique for automatic recognition of structural components from a point cloud and image

Project 2: Simplified Steel Connection  funded by Enterprise Ireland under commercialization fund program
Main duty:  Overseen a numerical modelling of new steel connections

Project 3: Advanced Manufacturing for the Assembly of Structural Steel funded by Science Foundation Ireland (SFI) under US Ireland R&D Partnership
Main duty:  Overseen a numerical modelling of new steel connections
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
RETURN: Rethinking Tunnelling for Urban Neighbourhoods.

- Developing a novel approach to reconstruct building models from computational modelling from LiDAR (aerial and terrestrial laser scanning) data.
- Explore LiDAR data for BIM/BrIM, and infrastructure assessment
- Co-supervise PhD, Master and Undergraduate students
- Main liaison with external collaborators (academia and industry)
profile_positions.title: Research Scientist

company.name: BRAM-BUILDING RISK ASSESSMENT & MANAGEMENT CONSULTING ENGINEERS (UCD spin-out company)

profile_positions.company: BRAM-BUILDING RISK ASSESSMENT & MANAGEMENT CONSULTING ENGINEERS (UCD spin-out company)
profile_positions.description:
Company activities:
- Software development (and sales and support) to convert point clouds and other pixelized data to solid models of building facades
- Software development (and sales and support) for feature detection from pixelized data
- Condition assessment documentation of existing built structures
- Condition assessment determination existing built structures
- Risk evaluation of buildings to be subjected to nearby construction (e.g. dewatering, blasting, subsidence, pile driving, traffic-induced vibration, adjacent tunnelling or excavation).
- Forensic investigation of damaged existing built structures
- Modeling and analyzing structures for post-damage portrayal or pre-construction risk evaluation
- Development of monitoring plans for existing built structures (particularly for buildings)
- Consultation of overall project risk management
- Expert witness testimony
- Support of solicitors in preparing background documentation for cases related to structures thought to be damaged by nearby construction or industrial activities.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
I am working on Mobile Spatial Data Mining of the StratAG project.

- Generated building models with level of details 3 from LiDAR data
- Developed a database system to store 3D geometric data of buildings associated with business data - - Visualized the building models in web-mapping platform for mobile spatial discovery and retrieval
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
I joined Urban modelling group to work for Generating Urban Infrastructures from LiDAR Data as PhD student. In this project, I have responsibility to develop novel algorithms that are to automatically generate solid models of building facades from LiDAR data for computational modelling, and validate these solid models in term of accurate level of geometry and FEM results. The masonry buildings were interesting in this work.

More specifically:
Develop algorithms for automatically 3D building reconstruction from LiDAR data
Assess building damage due to tunnelling/excavation-induced ground movement
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate
